feed.title: Google Cloud: BigQuery
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: BigQuery

entry.content: You can deduplicate table data with Gemini assistance in your BigQuery data preparations. Deduplication is in Preview.
entry.summary: Deduplicate your BigQuery table data with Gemini assistance. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Deduplicate table data

entry.content: You can use the ST_REGIONSTATS geography function to combine raster data using Earth Engine with your vector data stored in BigQuery. For more information, see Work with raster data and try the tutorial that shows you how to use raster data to analyze global temperature. This feature is generally available.
entry.summary: Combine Earth Engine raster data with your BigQuery vector data.
entry.title: Feature: ST_REGIONSTATS geography function

entry.content: You can now use data insights to have Gemini generate table and column descriptions from table metadata. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Gemini can now generate table and column descriptions from table metadata using data insights. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini can now generate table and column descriptions

entry.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the Cloud SDK.

Python

Changes for google-cloud-bigquery

3.36.0 (2025-08-20)

Features
  • Add created/started/ended properties to RowIterator. (#2260) (0a95b24)
  • Retry query jobs if jobBackendError or jobInternalError are encountered (#2256) (3deff1d)
Documentation
  • Add a TROUBLESHOOTING.md file with tips for logging (#2262) (b684832)
  • Update README to break infinite redirect loop (#2254) (8f03166)
entry.summary: Stay updated with the latest from our client libraries.
entry.title: Libraries: Client Library Updates

entry.content: Multi-statement transactions are now available for BigLake Iceberg tables in BigQuery. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Multi-statement transactions for BigLake Iceberg tables.
entry.title: Feature: New: Multi-statement Transactions for BigLake Iceberg Tables

entry.content:
Starting September 25, 2025, the BigQuery Data Transfer Service for third-party SAAS and database connectors will update to a consumption-based pricing model. With this new pricing model, you will be charged based on the compute resources consumed by your data transfers, measured in slot-hours. For more information, see Data Transfer Service pricing. This pricing update applies to the following third-party connectors when they are generally available (GA):

  • Facebook Ads
  • MySQL
  • Oracle
  • PostgreSQL
  • Salesforce
  • Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • ServiceNow
  • Other third-party connectors planned for future releases
entry.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service pricing update for third-party connectors.
entry.title: Announcement: Pricing Update

entry.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the Cloud SDK.

Java

Changes for google-cloud-bigquery

2.54.1 (2025-08-13)

Bug Fixes
  • Adapt graalvm config to arrow update (#3928) (ecfabc4)
Dependencies
  • Update dependency com.google.cloud:sdk-platform-java-config to v3.51.0 (#3924) (cb66be5)
entry.summary: A weekly digest of client library updates. Focus on Java, BigQuery, and bug fixes.
entry.title: Libraries: Client Library Updates

entry.content:
In the BigQuery console, you can now use the Reference panel to do the following:

  • In the query editor, you can use the Reference panel to preview the schema details of tables, snapshots, views, and materialized views, or open these resources in a new tab. You can also use the panel to construct new queries or edit existing queries by inserting query snippets or field names.
  • In the notebook editor, you can use the Reference panel to preview the schema details of tables, snapshots, views, or materialized views, or open these resources in a new tab.

This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Preview schema details and construct queries using the Reference panel in BigQuery.
entry.title: Feature: Reference Panel Now Available in BigQuery

entry.content: When you use the Data Science Agent in BigQuery, you can now use the table selector to choose one or more BigQuery tables to analyze. The Data Science Agent is in Preview.
entry.summary: Easily select BigQuery tables for analysis with the Data Science Agent.
entry.title: Feature: New Table Selector for BigQuery Data Science Agent

entry.content: You can now visualize your geospatial query results on an interactive map in BigQuery studio. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: Visualize your geospatial query results on an interactive map.
entry.title: Feature: Geospatial Visualization

entry.content: You can use cross region federated queries to query Spanner tables from regions other than the source BigQuery region. These cross region queries incur additional Spanner network egress charges. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Cross-region queries for Spanner are now available.
entry.title: Feature: New Spanner feature

entry.content: You can aggregate table data with Gemini assistance in your BigQuery data preparations. Aggregations in data preparations are in Preview.
entry.summary: Aggregate table data with Gemini assistance.
entry.title: Feature: Feature Announcement

entry.content: You can now save query results to Cloud Storage. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Query results can now be saved to Cloud Storage.
entry.title: Feature: New Cloud Storage Feature

entry.content: BigQuery resource utilization charts are generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery resource utilization charts are now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery resource utilization charts

entry.content: You can now use WITH expressions in your GoogleSQL queries to create temporary variables. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Use WITH expressions for temporary variables.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: WITH expressions

entry.content: You can now use chained function call syntax in GoogleSQL to make deeply nested function calls easier to read. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Easily read nested function calls with chained function syntax.
entry.title: Feature: Chained Function Calls Now Available

entry.content: BigQuery data preparations are now represented in the SQLX format and in the pipe query syntax to simplify the CI/CD code review process. For more information, see Manage data preparations.
entry.summary: BigQuery data preparations are now in SQLX format and pipe query syntax.
entry.title: Changed: Updated BigQuery Data Preparations

entry.content: Enabling the advanced runtime now includes short query optimizations. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: Short query optimizations are now available with advanced runtime.
entry.title: Feature: New feature available

entry.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the Cloud SDK.

Java

Changes for google-cloud-bigquery

2.54.0 (2025-07-31)

Features
  • bigquery: Add OpenTelemetry Samples (#3899) (e3d9ed9)
  • bigquery: Add otel metrics to request headers (#3900) (4071e4c)
Dependencies
  • update dependency com.google.cloud:google-cloud-bigquerystorage-bom to v3.16.1 (#3912) (https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/commit/bb6f6dcb90b1ddf72e630c4dc64737cf2c2ebd2e)
  • Update dependency com.google.api.grpc:proto-google-cloud-bigqueryconnection-v1 to v2.70.0 (#3890) (84207e2)
  • Update dependency com.google.apis:google-api-services-bigquery to v2-rev20250706-2.0.0 (#3910) (ae5c971)
  • Update dependency com.google.cloud:sdk-platform-java-config to v3.50.2 (#3901) (8205623)
  • Update dependency io.opentelemetry:opentelemetry-api to v1.52.0 (#3902) (772407b)
  • Update dependency io.opentelemetry:opentelemetry-bom to v1.52.0 (#3903) (509a6fc)
  • Update dependency io.opentelemetry:opentelemetry-context to v1.52.0 (#3904) (96c1bae)
  • Update dependency io.opentelemetry:opentelemetry-exporter-logging to v1.52.0 (#3905) (28ee4c9)
entry.summary: Java BigQuery client library updates.
entry.title: Libraries: Java BigQuery Updates

entry.content: You can now use the new Data Science Agent (DSA) for Colab Enterprise and BigQuery to automate exploratory data analysis, perform machine learning tasks, and deliver insights all within a Colab Enterprise notebook. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: Automate data analysis and machine learning tasks in Colab Enterprise.
entry.title: Feature: New Data Science Agent for Colab Enterprise

entry.content: You can manage data profile scans and data quality scans across your project by using the Metadata curation page in the Google Cloud console. For more information, see Profile your data and Scan for data quality issues. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Manage data scans on the Metadata curation page.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: Data Scan Management

entry.content:
BigQuery ML has improved throughput by more than 100x for the following generative AI functions:

  • ML.GENERATE_TEXT
  • AI.GENERATE_TABLE
  • AI.GENERATE
  • AI.GENERATE_BOOL
  • AI.GENERATE_DOUBLE
  • AI.GENERATE_INT

Actual performance varies based on the number of input and output tokens in the request, but a typical 6-hour job can now process millions of rows. For more information, see Generative AI functions.
entry.summary: BigQuery ML boosts generative AI function throughput by over 100x.
entry.title: Changed: Improved BigQuery ML Performance

entry.content: BigQuery ML now can automatically detect model quota increases in Vertex AI, and automatically adjusts the quota for any BigQuery ML functions that use those models. You no longer need to email the BigQuery ML team to increase model quota.
entry.summary: BigQuery ML now automatically detects and adjusts model quotas in Vertex AI, eliminating the need to contact the BigQuery ML team for increases.
entry.title: Changed: BigQuery ML Model Quota Updates

entry.content: You can now use continuous queries to export BigQuery data to Spanner in real time. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Real-time data export to Spanner with continuous queries.
entry.title: Feature: Real-time Spanner Exports

entry.content: The Gemini for Google Cloud API (cloudaicompanion.googleapis.com) is now enabled by default for most BigQuery projects. Exceptions include projects where customers have opted out, and those linked to accounts based in EMEA regions including BigQuery Europe, Middle East, and Africa regions.
entry.summary: Gemini for Google Cloud is now enabled by default for most BigQuery projects.
entry.title: Announcement: Gemini for Google Cloud in BigQuery

entry.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the Cloud SDK.

Node.js

Changes for @google-cloud/bigquery

8.1.1 (2025-07-23)

Bug Fixes
  • Remove is package as dependency (#1500) (926c9f8)

Python

Changes for google-cloud-bigquery

3.35.1 (2025-07-21)

Documentation
  • Specify the inherited-members directive for job classes (#2244) (d207f65)
entry.summary: Client library updates for Node.js and Python.
entry.title: Libraries: Client Library Updates

entry.content: You can now associate data policies directly on columns. This feature enables direct database administration for controlling access and applying masking and transformation rules at the column level. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Data policies can now be associated directly on columns for database administration, access control, and masking/transformation rules.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: Column-level data policies

entry.content: You can now use the VECTOR_INDEX.STATISTICS function to calculate how much an indexed table's data has drifted between when a vector index was created and the present. If table data has changed enough to require a vector index rebuild, you can use the ALTER VECTOR INDEX REBUILD statement to rebuild the vector index. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Check vector index data drift and rebuild if necessary.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: Vector Index Monitoring

entry.content: Access Transparency supports BigQuery data preparation in the GA stage.
entry.summary: Access Transparency now supports BigQuery data preparation.
entry.title: Feature: Access Transparency for BigQuery

entry.content:
The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE and LOAD DATA statements now support the following options in Preview:

  • null_markers: define the strings that represent NULL values in CSV files.
  • source_column_match: specify how loaded columns are matched to the schema. You can match columns by position or by name.
entry.summary: New options for CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE and LOAD DATA
entry.title: Feature: New options available

entry.content: You can now use the MATCH_RECOGNIZE clause in your SQL queries to filter and aggregate matches across rows in a table. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Filter and aggregate matches across rows using the MATCH_RECOGNIZE clause.
entry.title: Feature: New SQL Feature

entry.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the Cloud SDK.

Java

Changes for google-cloud-bigquery

2.53.0 (2025-07-14)

Features
  • bigquery: Add OpenTelemetry support to BigQuery rpcs (#3860) (e2d23c1)
  • bigquery: Add support for custom timezones and timestamps (#3859) (e5467c9)
  • Next release from main branch is 2.53.0 (#3879) (c47a062)
Bug Fixes
  • Load jobs preserve ascii control characters configuration (#3876) (5cfdf85)
Dependencies
  • Update dependency com.google.api.grpc:proto-google-cloud-bigqueryconnection-v1 to v2.69.0 (#3870) (a7f1007)
  • Update dependency com.google.apis:google-api-services-bigquery to v2-rev20250615-2.0.0 (#3872) (f081589)
  • Update dependency com.google.cloud:sdk-platform-java-config to v3.50.1 (#3878) (0e971b8)
Documentation
  • Update maven format command (#3877) (d2918da)

Python

Changes for google-cloud-bigquery

3.35.0 (2025-07-15)

Features
  • Add null_markers property to LoadJobConfig and CSVOptions (#2239) (289446d)
  • Add total slot ms to RowIterator (#2233) (d44bf02)
  • Add UpdateMode to update_dataset (#2204) (eb9c2af)
  • Adds dataset_view parameter to get_dataset method (#2198) (28a5750)
  • Adds date_format to load job and external config (#2231) (7d31828)
  • Adds datetime_format as an option (#2236) (54d3dc6)
  • Adds source_column_match and associated tests (#2227) (6d5d236)
  • Adds time_format and timestamp_format and associated tests (#2238) (371ad29)
  • Adds time_zone to external config and load job (#2229) (b2300d0)
Bug Fixes
  • Adds magics.context.project to eliminate issues with unit tests â€¦ (#2228) (27ff3a8)
  • Fix rows returned when both start_index and page_size are provided (#2181) (45643a2)
  • Make AccessEntry equality consistent with from_api_repr (#2218) (4941de4)
  • Update type hints for various BigQuery files (#2206) (b863291)
Documentation
  • Improve clarity of "Output Only" fields in Dataset class (#2201) (bd5aba8)
entry.summary: This is a weekly digest of client library updates across the Cloud SDK, featuring new features like OpenTelemetry support and custom timezone handling for Java, alongside various enhancements and bug fixes in the Python library, including updates to job configuration and data handling.
entry.title: Libraries: Client Library Updates: Java and Python

entry.content: You can now use the DISTINCT pipe operator to select distinct rows from a table in your pipe syntax queries. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now use the DISTINCT pipe operator to select distinct rows from a table in your pipe syntax queries. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: DISTINCT pipe operator is now GA

entry.content: You can now use the WITH pipe operator to define common table expressions in your pipe syntax queries. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery now supports the `WITH` pipe operator for defining common table expressions in pipe syntax queries. This enhancement is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: `WITH` Pipe Operator Now Available in BigQuery

entry.content: You can now use named windows in your pipe syntax queries. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Named windows are now generally available in pipe syntax queries.
entry.title: Feature: Named windows are now GA

entry.content: You can now add comments to notebooks, data canvases, data preparation files, or saved queries. You can also reply to existing comments or get a link to them. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now add comments to notebooks, data canvases, data preparation files, or saved queries. You can also reply to comments or get a link to them. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Add comments to BigQuery assets

entry.content: You can now create BigQuery ML models by using the Google Cloud console user interface. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now create BigQuery ML models using the Google Cloud console interface. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery ML models creation in Google Cloud console

entry.content: You can now commercialize your BigQuery sharing listings on Google Cloud Marketplace. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now commercialize your BigQuery sharing listings on Google Cloud Marketplace. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Commercialize BigQuery listings on Google Cloud Marketplace

entry.content: You can flatten JSON columns in BigQuery data preparation with a single operation. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now flatten JSON columns in BigQuery data preparation with a single operation. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Flatten JSON columns in BigQuery

entry.content: Starting August 1, 2025, GoogleSQL will become the default dialect for queries run from the command line interface (CLI) or API. To use LegacySQL, you will need to explicitly specify it in your requests or set the configuration setting default_sql_dialect_option to 'default_legacy_sql' at the project or organization level.
entry.summary: GoogleSQL will be the default dialect for CLI and API queries starting August 1, 2025. LegacySQL will require explicit specification or a configuration setting change.
entry.title: Announcement: GoogleSQL becomes default CLI/API dialect on August 1, 2025

entry.content: You can now use your Google Account user credentials to authorize the execution of a data preparation in development. For more information, see Manually run a data preparation in development. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: You can now use your Google Account user credentials to authorize the execution of a data preparation in development. This feature is in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Use Google Account Credentials for Data Preparation Authorization

entry.content: You can now update a Cloud KMS encryption key by updating the table with the same key. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now update a Cloud KMS encryption key by updating the table with the same key. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Key update feature now available

entry.content: You can use the @@location system variable to set the location in which to run a query. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now set the location for your queries using the @@location system variable. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Query location now available

entry.content:
BigQuery now supports the following Apache Hadoop migration features in Preview:

  • Use the dwh-migration-dumper tool to migrate the metadata necessary for a Hadoop permissions and data migration.
  • Migrate permissions from Apache Hadoop, Apache Hive, and Ranger HDFS to BigQuery.
  • Migrate tables from a HDFS data lake to Google Cloud.
entry.summary: BigQuery is introducing new features to help migrate data from Apache Hadoop, including tools for metadata and permissions migration, as well as transferring tables from HDFS data lakes.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery enhances Hadoop migration support

entry.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the Cloud SDK.

Java

Changes for google-cloud-bigquery

2.52.0 (2025-06-25)

Features
  • bigquery: Integrate Otel in client lib (#3747) (6e3e07a)
  • bigquery: Integrate Otel into retries, jobs, and more (#3842) (4b28c47)
Bug Fixes
  • bigquery: Add MY_VIEW_DATASET_NAMETEST to resource clean up sample (#3838) (b1962a7)
Dependencies
  • Remove version declaration of open-telemetry-bom (#3855) (6f9f77d)
  • Update dependency com.google.api.grpc:proto-google-cloud-bigqueryconnection-v1 to v2.66.0 (#3835) (69be5e7)
  • Update dependency com.google.api.grpc:proto-google-cloud-bigqueryconnection-v1 to v2.68.0 (#3858) (d4ca353)
  • Update dependency com.google.cloud:sdk-platform-java-config to v3.49.2 (#3853) (cf864df)
  • Update dependency com.google.cloud:sdk-platform-java-config to v3.50.0 (#3861) (eb26dee)
  • Update dependency io.opentelemetry:opentelemetry-bom to v1.51.0 (#3840) (51321c2)
  • Update ossf/scorecard-action action to v2.4.2 (#3810) (414f61d)
entry.summary: This release of the Java client library for BigQuery includes new features such as OpenTelemetry integration for enhanced monitoring and several bug fixes and dependency updates.
entry.title: Libraries: Java BigQuery Library Update

entry.content: You can now create and manage scheduled notebooks using the Schedule details pane in BigQuery Studio. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now orchestrate your notebooks using the Schedule details pane in BigQuery Studio. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Schedule notebook runs in BigQuery Studio

entry.content: You can now use the use the PARTITION BY clause of the CREATE VECTOR INDEX statement to partition TreeAH vector indexes. Partitioning enables partition pruning and can decrease I/O costs. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery now supports partitioning for TreeAH vector indexes using the PARTITION BY clause in the CREATE VECTOR INDEX statement. This feature, currently in preview, can help reduce I/O costs through partition pruning.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery adds support for partitioning TreeAH vector indexes

entry.content: BigQuery search indexes provide free index management until your organization reaches the limit in a given region. You can now use the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.SEARCH_INDEXES_BY_ORGANIZATION view to understand your current consumption towards that limit, broken down by projects and tables. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery search indexes offer free management up to regional limits. You can now monitor your organization's index consumption by project and table using the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.SEARCH_INDEXES_BY_ORGANIZATION view. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery Search Indexes Now GA

entry.content: You can now use the Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore to create interoperability between your query engines by allowing your open source engines to access Iceberg data in Cloud Storage. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now use the Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore to create interoperability between your query engines. This allows open source engines to access Iceberg data in Cloud Storage. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: BigLake metastore now supports Apache Iceberg REST catalog

entry.content:
Colab Enterprise notebooks in BigQuery let you do the following in Preview:

  • Explain code with Gemini assistance
  • Fix and explain errors with Gemini assistance
entry.summary: BigQuery now supports Colab Enterprise notebooks, allowing you to leverage Gemini assistance for code explanation and error resolution directly within your BigQuery environment.
entry.title: Feature: Colab Enterprise notebooks in BigQuery

entry.content: You can now publish the results of a data quality scan as Dataplex Universal Catalog metadata. Previously, data quality scan results were published only to the Google Cloud console. The latest results are saved to the entry that represents the source table. You can view the results in the Google Cloud console. If you want to enable catalog publishing for an existing data quality scan, you must edit the scan and re-enable the publishing option. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Data quality scan results can now be published as Dataplex Universal Catalog metadata, with the latest results saved to the source table's entry. This feature is generally available and viewable in the Google Cloud console.
entry.title: Feature: Data Quality Scan Results Now Available in Dataplex Catalog

entry.content: You can now use data insights to have Gemini generate table and column descriptions from table metadata. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Gemini can now create table and column descriptions from metadata, using data insights. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini generates table descriptions

entry.content: In BigQuery ML, you can now forecast multiple time series at once by using the TIME_SERIES_ID_COL option that is available in ARIMA_PLUS_XREG multivariate time series models. Try this feature with the Forecast multiple time series with a multivariate model tutorial. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery ML now supports forecasting multiple time series simultaneously using the `TIME_SERIES_ID_COL` option in `ARIMA_PLUS_XREG` models. This enhancement allows for more efficient analysis of multiple time series data. Check out the tutorial for a practical guide.
entry.title: Feature: Forecasting Multiple Time Series in BigQuery ML

entry.content: You can now manage IAM tags on BigQuery datasets and tables using SQL. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now manage IAM tags on BigQuery datasets and tables using SQL. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Manage IAM tags on BigQuery datasets and tables using SQL

entry.content: The BigQuery migration assessment is now available for workflows that use Cloudera and Apache Hadoop. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: The BigQuery migration assessment tool now supports workflows utilizing Cloudera and Apache Hadoop. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery migration assessment now supports Hadoop and Cloudera

entry.content: The Merchant Center best sellers report supports multi-client accounts (MCAs). If you have an MCA, you can use the aggregator_id to query the tables. The BestSellersEntityProductMapping table maps the best-selling entities to the products in the sub-accounts' inventory. This provides a consolidated view of best-selling products, which you can then join with product data for more detailed insights. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: The Merchant Center best sellers report now supports multi-client accounts (MCAs), allowing you to use the `aggregator_id` for queries. The `BestSellersEntityProductMapping` table helps map best-selling products across sub-accounts, providing a consolidated view for deeper analysis.
entry.title: Feature: Merchant Center best sellers report now supports MCAs

entry.content:
BigQuery now offers the following Gemini-enhanced SQL translation features:

  • Create Gemini-based configuration YAML files to generate AI suggestions for batch or interactive SQL translations. This feature is now generally available (GA).
  • After making a batch SQL translation, review your translation output, including Gemini-based suggestions, using the code tab and configuration tab. This feature is now generally available (GA).
  • When making an interactive SQL translation, create and apply Gemini-enhanced translation rules to customize your SQL inputs. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery has enhanced its SQL translation capabilities with Gemini. Users can now leverage Gemini-based configurations for SQL translations, with features for both batch and interactive use cases now generally available. Additionally, interactive SQL translation allows for the creation and application of customized, Gemini-enhanced translation rules during the preview phase.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini enhances BigQuery SQL translation

entry.content: Dark theme is now available for BigQuery in Preview. To enable the dark theme, in the Google Cloud console, click Settings and utilities > Preferences. In the navigation menu, click Appearance, and then select your color theme and click Save.
entry.summary: You can now enable a dark theme for BigQuery in the Google Cloud console. To do this, navigate to Settings and utilities > Preferences > Appearance and select your preferred color theme.
entry.title: Feature: Dark Theme Now Available for BigQuery

entry.content:
The following GoogleSQL functions are now available in preview:

  • The ARRAY_FIRST function returns the first element of the input array.
  • The ARRAY_LAST function returns the last element of the input array.
  • The ARRAY_SLICE function returns an array that contains consecutive elements from the input array.
entry.summary: Two new GoogleSQL functions, ARRAY_LAST and ARRAY_SLICE, are now available in preview to help you manipulate array data.
entry.title: Feature: New GoogleSQL functions available

entry.content: An updated version of the ODBC driver for BigQuery is now available.
entry.summary: An updated version of the ODBC driver for BigQuery has been released.
entry.title: Changed: Updated ODBC driver for BigQuery

entry.content:
For supported Gemini models, you can now use Vertex AI Provisioned Throughput with the ML.GENERATE_TEXTand AI.GENERATE functions to provide consistent high throughput for requests.

This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now use Vertex AI Provisioned Throughput with the ML.GENERATE_TEXT and AI.GENERATE functions in BigQuery. This provides consistent high throughput for requests to supported Gemini models and is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Vertex AI Provisioned Throughput now available in BigQuery

entry.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the Cloud SDK.

Java

Changes for google-cloud-bigquery

2.51.0 (2025-06-06)

Features
  • bigquery: Job creation mode GA (#3804) (a21cde8)
  • bigquery: Support Fine Grained ACLs for Datasets (#3803) (bebf1c6)
Dependencies
  • Rollback netty.version to v4.1.119.Final (#3827) (94c71a0)
  • Update dependency com.google.api.grpc:proto-google-cloud-bigqueryconnection-v1 to v2.65.0 (#3787) (0574ecc)
  • Update dependency com.google.apis:google-api-services-bigquery to v2-rev20250511-2.0.0 (#3794) (d3bf724)
  • Update dependency com.google.cloud:sdk-platform-java-config to v3.49.0 (#3811) (2c5ede4)
entry.summary: This release of the Java client library for BigQuery introduces new features such as GA for job creation mode and support for Fine Grained Access Control Lists for Datasets. It also includes dependency updates and a rollback for the netty version.
entry.title: Libraries: Java BigQuery Client Library Updates

entry.content: You can reference Iceberg external tables in materialized views instead of migrating that data to BigQuery-managed storage. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now use Iceberg external tables in materialized views without migrating data to BigQuery-managed storage. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Iceberg external tables in materialized views are now GA

entry.content: The organization-level configuration settings for default_sql_dialect_option and query_runtime are unsupported.
entry.summary: The organization-level configuration settings for default SQL dialect option and query runtime are unsupported.
entry.title: Changed: Unsupported configuration settings

entry.content: You can now use the BigQuery advanced runtime to improve query execution time and slot usage. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQueryâ€™s advanced runtime is now available in Preview, allowing for improved query execution times and slot utilization.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery advanced runtime now in Preview

entry.content: BigQuery tables for Apache Iceberg have been renamed BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery. This feature is now generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery are now generally available, with tables having been renamed.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery support for Apache Iceberg is now GA

entry.content: BigQuery metastore has been renamed BigLake metastore and is now generally available (GA). The feature formerly known as BigLake metastore has been renamed BigLake metastore (classic).
entry.summary: BigQuery metastore has been renamed to BigLake metastore and is now generally available. The feature previously known as BigLake metastore is now called BigLake metastore (classic).
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery metastore is now BigLake metastore

entry.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the Cloud SDK.

Node.js

Changes for @google-cloud/bigquery

8.1.0 (2025-05-29)

Features
  • Job creation mode GA (#1480) (b51359a)
  • Support per-job reservation assignment (#1477) (8151e72)

Go

Changes for bigquery/storage/apiv1beta1

1.69.0 (2025-05-27)

Features
  • bigquery/analyticshub: Add support for Analytics Hub & Marketplace Integration (2aaada3)
  • bigquery/analyticshub: Adding allow_only_metadata_sharing to Listing resource (2aaada3)
  • bigquery/analyticshub: Adding CommercialInfo message to the Listing and Subscription resources (2aaada3)
  • bigquery/analyticshub: Adding delete_commercial and revoke_commercial to DeleteListingRequest and RevokeSubscriptionRequest (2aaada3)
  • bigquery/analyticshub: Adding DestinationDataset to the Subscription resource (2aaada3)
  • bigquery/analyticshub: Adding routine field to the SharedResource message (2aaada3)
  • bigquery: Add support for dataset view and update modes (#12290) (7c1f961)
  • bigquery: Job creation mode GA (#12225) (1d8990d)

Python

Changes for google-cloud-bigquery

3.34.0 (2025-05-27)

Features
  • Job creation mode GA (#2190) (64cd39f)
Bug Fixes
  • deps: Update all dependencies (#2184) (12490f2)
Documentation
  • Update query.py (#2192) (9b5ee78)
  • Use query_and_wait in the array parameters sample (#2202) (28a9994)
entry.summary: This is a weekly digest of client library updates across Node.js, Go, and Python BigQuery libraries. Key updates include the GA release of job creation mode for Node.js and Go, and enhancements to Analytics Hub and Marketplace integration in Go.
entry.title: Libraries: Client Library Updates: BigQuery

entry.content: In the navigation menu, you can now go to Settings and select Configuration settings to customize the BigQuery Studio experience for users within the selected project or organization. This is achieved by showing or hiding user interface elements. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: You can now customize the BigQuery Studio experience by showing or hiding UI elements through configuration settings. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Customize BigQuery Studio Experience

entry.content: BigQuery now supports using Spanner external datasets with authorized views, authorized routines, and Cloud resource connections. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery now supports Spanner external datasets with authorized views, authorized routines, and Cloud resource connections. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery adds Spanner external datasets support

entry.content:
The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE and LOAD DATA statements now support the following options in preview:

  • time_zone: specify a time zone to use when loading data
  • date_format, datetime_format, time_format, and timestamp_format: define how date and time values are formatted in your source files
entry.summary: You can now specify time zone and date/time formats when creating external tables or loading data using the `CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE` and `LOAD DATA` statements.
entry.title: Feature: New options for data loading and external tables

entry.content: In the BigQuery console, in the Welcome tab, you can now try the Apache Spark demo notebook that walks you through the basics of Spark notebook and showcases serverless Spark in BigQuery. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now explore a new Apache Spark demo notebook directly within the BigQuery console. This feature, now generally available, guides you through the fundamentals of Spark notebooks and highlights the capabilities of serverless Spark in BigQuery.
entry.title: Feature: Try the new Spark demo notebook in BigQuery

entry.content: You can now use the dbt-bigquery adapter to run Python code that's defined in BigQuery DataFrames. For more information, see Use BigQuery DataFrames in dbt. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: You can now use the `dbt-bigquery` adapter to run Python code defined in BigQuery DataFrames. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery DataFrames in dbt

entry.content: You can now use your Google Account user credentials to authorize the creation, scheduling, and running of pipelines as well as the scheduling of notebooks and data preparations. For more information, see Create a pipeline schedule. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: You can now use your Google Account credentials to authorize the creation, scheduling, and running of pipelines, as well as the scheduling of notebooks and data preparations. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Authorize pipeline creation and scheduling with your Google Account

entry.content: You can now create event-driven transfers when transferring data from Cloud Storage to BigQuery. Event-driven transfers can automatically trigger transfer runs when data in your Cloud Storage bucket has been modified or added. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now create event-driven transfers from Cloud Storage to BigQuery. These transfers automatically trigger when data in your Cloud Storage bucket is modified or added, and this feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: New feature: Event-driven transfers from Cloud Storage to BigQuery

entry.content: You can now create a serverless Spark session and run PySpark code in a BigQuery notebook. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now create a serverless Spark session and run PySpark code in a BigQuery notebook. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Serverless Spark sessions in BigQuery notebooks are now available

entry.content: Column metadata indexing is now available for both BigQuery tables and external tables. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Column metadata indexing, a new feature for BigQuery, is now generally available for both managed and external tables. This enhancement improves data management and accessibility.
entry.title: Feature: Column Metadata Indexing Now GA

entry.content: You can now share Pub/Sub streaming data through BigQuery sharing with additional client libraries support and provider usage metrics. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery streaming data sharing for Pub/Sub is now generally available. This feature supports additional client libraries and provides provider usage metrics.
entry.title: Feature: Pub/Sub data sharing with BigQuery now GA

entry.content: BigQuery offers optional job creation mode to speed up small queries that you use in your dashboards, data exploration, and other workflows. This mode automatically optimizes eligible queries and uses a cache to improve latency. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery now provides an optional job creation mode that automatically optimizes eligible queries and uses a cache to improve latency, making it faster for workflows like dashboards and data exploration. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery Optional Job Creation Mode is Ready
